enrl_requirement:
Enrollment Requirements: Co-Requisite: Students must also register for Chemistry 121-CN.
Add both classes to the shopping cart and submit together for successful registration.
title: SCS CHEM 101-CN-65 General Chemistry

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value:
This course is the first of a three-course sequence that is completed by CHEM 102 in the winter quarter and CHEM 103 in the spring quarter. Topics covered in the course include descriptive chemistry: elements and compounds; basic chemical calculations: mole problems, stoichiometry, and solution concentrations; gas laws; thermochemistry; quantum theory and electronic structure of atoms; periodic properties of the elements; chemical bonding.

Includes a Saturday laboratory (CHEM 121-CN) from 9 a.m. -12 p.m. that requires separate registration. This course also has a recitation (discussion) section from 12-1pm on Saturdays.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value:
High school chemistry, college algebra, or higher college math course.

Knowledge of calculus is highly advantageous. An understanding of the following mathematics topics is necessary for satisfactory completion of the course: 1) simplifying algebraic expressions, 2) solving first-order equations, 3) solving quadratic equations, 4) manipulating logarithms and exponents and 5) linear regression using the model y = mx + b.

subject: CHEM
